LineItemTitle.val: Joint Precision Approach and Landing System(JPALS)

Description.val: The Joint Precision Approach and Landing System (JPALS) is the primary precision approach and landing system for CVN and LHA/D ships to support aircraft without SPN-46 Automatic Carrier Landing Systems (ACLS) capability, which include F-35B, F-35C, MQ-25 and future platforms. JPALS ship systems are required to provide CVN and LHA/D ships a primary precision approach capability during night and instrument flight conditions, including coupled approach capability to a hover transition point for LHA/D ships, and coupled approach to the deck (auto-land) capability aboard CVN ships. JPALS also provides over-the-air inertial alignment capability for CVN and LHA/D ships to support aircraft platforms without Link-4A capability, including F-35, MQ-25 and future platforms.  JPALS MS B occurred June 2016 and MS C occurred April 2019.  Production contract awarded May 2019.

Justification.val: FY 2021 funds the procurement of eight JPALS Systems and other support necessary to field the JPALS ship systems onboard CVN and LHA/D ships that are required to provide the primary precision approach, landing, on-deck inertial alignment, surveillance, and auto-land capability for F-35B/C and all future low observable manned and unmanned platforms.

Name.@footnote: FY2020 to FY2021 ILS increase is due to the additional Interim Sustainment Contractor support required for the 10 fielded units in FY2021 (vice 3 in FY2020).  This additional funding also includes Repair of Repairables (ROR) support for anticipated failures and continued support to delivery of sparing and training packages and production phase ILS planning.

FY2020 to FY2021 increase in Production Engineering is driven by the beginning of engineering change order funding to mitigate production obsolescence issues as well as an increase in pre-installation activities (which includes drawing updates and ship change documents for additional units).

Hardware costs updated to reflect actual contract award values from LRIP contract (Base + 3 Options). Increases are a result of material cost growth and contractor production labor. Variability in 'year to year' pricing is due to the spread of contractor support labor across the contract options.

Description.val: JPALS ship systems are required to provide CVN and LH ships a primary precision approach capability during night and instrument flight conditions, including coupled approach capability to a hover transition point for LHA/D ships, and coupled approach to the deck (auto-land) capability aboard CVN ships. JPALS also provides over-the-air inertial alignment capability for CVN and LHA/D ships to support aircraft platforms without Link-4A capability, including F-35, MQ-25 and future platforms.  Procurements started third quarter FY 2019 after completion of MS C.
